info.title: myGenAssist Platform API
info.description:
myGenAssist, the gateway to generative AI in Bayerüìö.

## Authentication üîíÔ∏è

First authenticate using the button on the right side.

## Functionalities üë∑

You are able to try out everything here but if you prefer the redoc, visit `/api/v1/redoc`.

## Contact üì±

**myGenAssist Support**, `please raise an incident in the IT4U under the assignment group of myGenAssist_Support`

get.description:
Retrieve a list of users based on specified filters.

- Args:
    - `user_name` **(Optional[str])**: Username to filter by.
    - `user_fullname` **(Optional[str])**: User fullname to filter by.
    - `user_email` **(Optional[str])**: User email to filter by.
    - `offset` **(Optional[int])**: Skip a specified number of records for pagination. Default is 0.
    - `limit` **(Optional[int])**: Maximum number of records to return. Defaults to 100.

- Returns:
    - `list[Account]`: List of accounts matching the specified filters.

patch.description:
Modify the budget for a selected user.

This action can be performed only by admin or budget manager users.

- Args:
    - **budget_increase_input** (*BudgetModificationInput*): Required. Includes details for budget modification.
        - **username** (*str*): Target user's username.
        - **email** (*str*): User's email for verification.
        - **new_budget** (*float*): The updated budget amount (must be non-negative; default is 5.0).

- Raises:
    - **HTTPException**: 403, if the current user is neither an admin or budget manager user.

schema.description: Details for modifying the budget of a user, including username, email, and new budget amount.

default.description: Increase the budget for a specific user.

post.description:
Subscribe the authenticated user to a specified newsletter category.

This endpoint allows the user to subscribe to a newsletter by specifying a category.

- Args:
    - `newsletter_category` **(NewsletterCategory)**: The category of newsletter the user wants to subscribe to. Default is `USER`.

- Returns:
    - `True`: Indicates successful subscription to the newsletter.
    - `False`: Indicates the subscription attempt failed, possibly due to service issues or if Kelia is disabled.

get.description:
Get account metadata.

This endpoint allows admins to view any account's metadata, while regular users can only view their own.

- Args:
    - `username` **(str)**: The username of the account to get metadata for.

- Returns:

- Raises:
    - **HTTPException**: 403, if the current user is not authorized to view this account's metadata.
    - **HTTPException**: 404, if the account is not found.

post.description:
Create a new assistant.

Allows for creating a new assistant with a specified logo, name, description, and configuration details.

**Note**: Assistant name should be at least 3 characters long.

- Args:
    - `assistant_logo` **(UploadFile)**: Required. The logo file for the assistant. Must meet file type and size requirements.
    - `assistant_input` **(AssistantInput)**: Required. The input data for the assistant, including name, description, and other configuration details.

- Raises:
    - **HTTPException**: 400, if the file size exceeds the maximum or the file type is not accepted.
    - **HTTPException**: 409, if an assistant with the specified name already exists.
    - **HTTPException**: 500, if an error occurs while uploading the logo or for an unknown error.

- Returns:
    - `AssistantResponse`: The created assistant object, including its details.

- Example Value:
    ```json
    {
        "assistant_logo": "logo.png",
        "assistant_input": {
            "name": "My Assistant",
            "description": "An assistant for personal tasks.",
            "instructions": "Your role is to be a supportive assistant. Pay close attention to the user's requests and follow them diligently.",
            "temperature": 0.7,
            "access": "public",
            "model": "gpt-4o",
            "tags": ["tag1", "tag2"],
            "tools": ["tool1", "tool2"],
            "file_ids": [1, 2],
            "starter_messages": ["Hello! How can I assist you today?"]
        }
    }
    ```

get.description:
Retrieve a list of available assistants based on specified filter criteria.

This endpoint returns assistants based on various filters such as category, name, tags, keywords, owner, and favorited status. It supports pagination.

- Args:
    - `category` **(AssistantCategory)**: Category filter, e.g., `favorites`, `my_assistants`, or `shared`. Defaults to `ALL`.
    - `name` **(Optional[str])**: Filter by assistant name, requiring at least 3 characters. Defaults to None.
    - `tags` **(Optional[list[constr(min_length=2)]])**: Filter by tags with each at least 2 characters; up to 5 tags allowed. Defaults to None.
    - `keyword` **(Optional[str])**: Keyword for fuzzy matching in names, tags, and descriptions. Defaults to None.
    - `owner` **(Optional[str])**: Filter by owner's name, username, or email. Use `@me` for current user. Defaults to None.
    - `favorited` **(Optional[bool])**: Filter by favorited status:
        - If `True`, returns only favorited assistants.
        - If `False`, excludes favorited assistants.
        - If not specified, includes both.
    - `limit` **(int)**: Number of results to return, defaults to 20.
    - `offset` **(int)**: Number of results to skip, defaults to 0.
    - `topic` **(Optional[str])**: Filter by topic. Defaults to None.

- Raises:
    - **HTTPException**: 400, if an invalid topic is provided.

- Returns:
    - `Dict[str, Optional[list[AssistantResponseWithOwner]]]`: A dictionary containing lists of assistants that match the filter criteria.

parameters.name: category

schema.description: Filter to limit results to a specific assistant category, such as 'favorites', 'my_assistants', or 'shared'. Defaults to 'ALL'.

post.description:
Add a new topic to the assistant.

Allows the addition of a new topic with a specified logo, name, and description.

- Args:
    - `topic_logo` **(UploadFile)**: Required. The logo file for the topic.
    - `topic_input` **(TopicInput)**: Required. The input data for the topic, including its name, description, and metadata.

- Raises:
    - **HTTPException**: 403, if the current user lacks permission to add topics.
    - **HTTPException**: 409, if a topic with the specified name already exists.

- Example Value:
    ```json
    {
        "topic_logo": "logo.png",
        "topic_input": {
            "name": "My Topic",
            "description": "This is a description of my topic.",
            "topic_metadata": {
                "keywords": ["keyword1", "keyword2"]
            }
        }
    }
    ```

patch.description:
Update the details of a specified topic by name.

Allows updating of a topic's details, including its name, description, logo, and metadata. The user must have appropriate permissions.

- Args:
    - `topic_name` **(str)**: The unique name of the topic to update.
    - `topic_logo` **(Optional[UploadFile])**: An optional logo file to replace the topic's current logo. If not provided, the logo remains unchanged.
    - `topic_patch` **(TopicPatchInput)**: The input data for updating the topic, including fields for name, description, and metadata.

- Raises:
    - **HTTPException**: 403, if the current user lacks permission to update topics.
    - **HTTPException**: 409, if a topic with the same name as the new name already exists.

- Returns:
    - `Topic`: The updated topic object containing the modified details.

- Example Value:
    ```json
    {
        "topic_name": "My Topic",
        "topic_logo": "logo.png",
        "topic_patch": {
            "name": "Updated Topic Name",
            "description": "Updated description of the topic.",
            "topic_metadata": {
                "keywords": ["updated_keyword1", "updated_keyword2"]
            }
        }
    }
    ```

post.description:
Chat with an Assistant in streaming and non-streaming mode.

*Caution*: This endpoint is experimental and in active development. Behaviour might change.

For stable chat completions please use the /chat/completions endpoint.

- This endpoint allows interaction with an Assistant in either streaming or non-streaming
mode. The behavior is controlled by the `stream` parameter.
- If an `assistant_id` is provided, the assistant's model, temperature,
and system prompt is used. In this case, the parameters in the body will be ignored.

### Arguments:
- **`request`** *(Request)*: The incoming HTTP request object.
- **`chat_completion_input`** *(ChatInputAgent)*: Input parameters for configuring assistant interaction.
- **`project`** *(Optional[str])*: Optional project identifier for tagging requests. Defaults to `None`.

*Key Body parameters*:
- **messages (list[Message]):** A list of messages comprising the conversation so far.
- **model (str, optional):** ID of the model to use. Required if no `assistant_id` is provided.
- **stream (bool, optional):** If True, use streaming mode. Defaults to False.
- **temperature (float):** What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Defaults to 0.
- **assistant_id (str, optional):** A UUID for the assistant to use.
- **tool_keys (list[str], optional):** A list of tools the assistant should have access to. 
 Defaults to ["document_question_answering", "document_summarizer", "uploaded_docs"].
- **conversation_id (str, optional):** A valid UUID for the conversation to continue. If ID doesn't exist, it throws 404 error. If no ID is provided, a new conversation is created.
- **hidden (bool, optional):** If True, the conversation is hidden from the myGenAssist UI. Defaults to False.

### Raises:
- **HTTPException**: 400, if `messages` are missing or `model` is not provided when `assistant_id` is absent.
- **HTTPException**: 404, if the specified model or assistant is not valid or conversation doesn't exist.

### Returns:
- **`Union[EventSourceResponse, OpenAIChatCompletionWithMetadata]`**: Streaming response or a metadata-enriched chat completion response.

Generate a chat completion response based on user input and model settings.

### Body Parameters:
- **model** (str): The ID of the model to be used. Required. Refer to the model documentation for compatible options.
- **messages** (list[ChatCompletionInputMessage]): A list of conversation messages in sequence, each with a role (e.g., "user" or "assistant") and content.
- **stream** (Optional[bool]): Enables streaming mode when set to `True`, delivering responses incrementally in real-time. Defaults to `False`.

### Header Parameters:
- **project** (Optional[str]): Optional project identifier, adding project-level context or tags to the request.

### Returns:
- **Union[ChatCompletion, EventSourceResponse]**: Returns a chat completion or streaming response if `stream` mode is enabled.

### Error Responses:
- **400**: Bad Request - Missing required fields.
- **422**: Unprocessable Entity - Malformed data or invalid parameter values.
- **503**: Service Unavailable - Service or dependencies are unavailable or unresponsive.

post.description:
**Document Question Answering (Doc QA) API Endpoint**

This endpoint enables users to ask questions related to specific documents. The system uses
document context to retrieve the most relevant answers. Responses may be returned as a single
response or as a stream, depending on the request configuration.

Will be depreciated. /chat/agent offer similar functionality by using `document_question_answering` tool.

### Key Parameters
- **`doc_qa_input` (ChatInputDocQA)**:
    - **`messages` (list[MessageBase])**: A list of messages representing the conversation so far. Includes role metadata (e.g., user or assistant) and message content.
    - **`parameters` (DocQAParameters)**:
        - **`files` (list[str], optional)**: A list of file names to limit the document search scope. Only these files will be considered for answering the question.
        - **`doc_limit` (int, optional)**: Maximum number of documents to retrieve for answering. Defaults to 5.
        - **`hypothetical_question` (bool, optional)**: If `True`, handles hypothetical questions. Defaults to `True`.
        - **`lost_in_the_middle` (bool, optional)**: Adjusts focus to avoid missing information in middle sections of documents. Defaults to `True`.
        - **`diversify_ranking` (bool, optional)**: If `True`, diversifies document rankings to reduce redundancy and improve response quality. Defaults to `True`.

- **`conversation_id` (uuid.UUID, optional)**: An optional ID to link the question to a specific conversation, enabling continuity across interactions.

### Raises
- **HTTPException**: 404 Not Found if the requested model is not available.

### Returns
- **Union[EventSourceResponse, OpenAIChatCompletionWithMetadata]**:
    Returns the answer to the question as either a standard response or as a streaming event source response.

post.description:
**Create Embeddings API Endpoint**

This endpoint generates embeddings for the provided input data using the specified model.

### Key Parameters
- **`embedding_input` (EmbeddingInput)**:
    - **`input` (Union[str, list[str], list[int], list[list[int]])**:
      The input data to embed. This can be:
      - A single string.
      - A list of strings.
      - A single list of integers (tokens).
      - A list of token arrays (lists of integers).
      - Input length must not exceed the model's maximum token limit.
    - **`model` (str)**: The ID of the model to be used for generating embeddings.
    - **`encoding_format` (EmbeddingEncodingFormat)**:
      Specifies the format of the returned embeddings:
      - `float`: Standard floating-point representation (default).
      - `base64`: Base64-encoded representation.
    - **`dimensions` (Optional[int])**:
      Specifies the number of dimensions for the output embeddings. This is supported
      for models like `text-embedding-3` and later. Defaults to the model's native dimensions.
    - **`user` (Optional[str])**: A unique identifier representing the end-user for abuse monitoring.

- **`project` (Optional[str])**:
    - An optional header (`mga-project`) to specify the project under which this embedding is being created.

### Raises
- **HTTPException**: If the input is invalid or if there are issues for creating the embeddings.

### Returns
- **EmbeddingResponse**: Contains the generated embeddings in the specified format (e.g., float or base64)
  along with any metadata.

value.input: This is an example text for embedding.

post.description:
# Evaluate the response of LLM using [Ragas](https://docs.ragas.io/en/latest/index.html).

## Supported metrics

Ragas support wide selection of metrics that you can use to evaluate LLM response in different dimentions. Below you can find a list of supported metrics.

- [faithfulness](https://docs.ragas.io/en/latest/concepts/metrics/faithfulness.html)
- [answer_relevancy](https://docs.ragas.io/en/latest/concepts/metrics/answer_relevance.html)
- [answer_similarity](https://docs.ragas.io/en/latest/concepts/metrics/semantic_similarity.html)
- [answer_correctness](https://docs.ragas.io/en/latest/concepts/metrics/answer_correctness.html)
- [context_entity_recall](https://docs.ragas.io/en/latest/concepts/metrics/context_entities_recall.html)
- [context_recall](https://docs.ragas.io/en/latest/concepts/metrics/context_recall.html)
- [context_precision](https://docs.ragas.io/en/latest/concepts/metrics/context_precision.html)
- [harmfulness](https://docs.ragas.io/en/latest/concepts/metrics/critique.html)
- [coherence](https://docs.ragas.io/en/latest/concepts/metrics/critique.html)
- [conciseness](https://docs.ragas.io/en/latest/concepts/metrics/critique.html)
- [summary_score](https://docs.ragas.io/en/latest/concepts/metrics/summarization_score.html)

### Body Parameters

- **`evaluation_input` (EvaluationInput)**:
    - **`evaluator_llm_model` (str)**: ID of the model to use as the evaluator. Defaults to `"gpt-4o-mini"`.
    - **`embedding_model` (str)**: ID of the embedding model to use. Defaults to `"text-embedding-3-small"`.
    - **`question` (Optional[str])**: The question being evaluated (if applicable).
    - **`contexts` (Optional[List[str]])**: Additional context(s) for the evaluation task.
    - **`answer` (Optional[str])**: The answer to evaluate.
    - **`ground_truth` (Optional[str])**: The expected correct answer or reference point for the evaluation.
    - **`metrics` (List[EvaluationMetric])**: The metrics to evaluate the answer against (e.g., accuracy, relevance).
    - **`answer_message_id` (Optional[uuid.UUID])**: An identifier for the answer message, if relevant.

### Raises
- **HTTPException**: 
    - **400**: If the provided LLM model is not a chat completion model or if the provided embedding model is invalid.
    - **404**: If the `answer_message_id` is not found.

### Returns
- **EvaluationResponse**: The results of the evaluation, including scores or relevant feedback based on the specified metrics.

simple-evaluation.description: Evaluate the LLM response using faithfulness and answer_relevancy metrics.

post.description:
Judge the response of LLM-based system using other LLM.

This endpoint allows you to define custom evaluation schema and submit `question`, `answer` and `contexts` triplets to be evaluated.

## Input Parameters

* **question**: Question or Request sent to LLM-based system.
* **answer**: Answer generated by LLM-based system to user request based on the retrieved `contexts`.
* **contexts**: List of the references used by LLM-based system to deliver the `answer`.
* **output_schema**: Definition of desired output schema:
    * **model_name**: Name of the desired output model
    * **fields**: Dictionary describing fields of the desired output, each field is defined as name, definition pair. Definition of the fields has following fields:
        * **field_type**: The type of the field, allowed options are `str`, `int`, `float`, `list`, `dict`
        * **description**: Description of the field used by LLM to fill it out accordingly
        * **required**: Boolean indicating if field is optional or not

## Output

### Default Output Schema
* **evaluation** (str): The reasoning behind the score. Comprehensive evaluation of the response. It should not be longer than 450 characters.
* **confidence** (float): Your confidence that the answer is correct expressed from 0 to 1.
* **answer_snippets_positive** (List[str]): Parts of the `system_answer` which attribute to the confidence score in a positive way.
* **answer_snippets_negative** (List[str]): Parts of the `system_answer` which attribute to the confidence score in a negative way (lowering the score).

### User-defined Output
JSON representing user defined Pydantic schema.

## Example

```json
{
    "question": "What is photosynthesis?",
    "contexts": ["Photosynthesis is the process..."],
    "answer": "Photosynthesis is how plants...",
    "output_schema": {
        "model_name": "CustomEvaluation",
        "fields": {
            "accuracy": {
                "field_type": "float",
                "description": "Accuracy score from 0 to 1",
                "required": true
            },
            "feedback": {
                "field_type": "str",
                "description": "Detailed feedback",
                "required": true
            }
        }
    }
}

        evaluation str: The reasoning behind the score. Comprehensive evaluation of the response. It should not be longer than 450 characters.,
        confidence float: Your confidence that the answer is correct expressed from 0 to 1.,
        answer_snippets_positive List[str]: Parts of the `system_answer` which attribute to the confidence score in a positive way.,
        answer_snippets_negative List[str]: Parts of the `system_answer` which attribute to the confidence score in a negative way (lowering the score).,

patch.description:
Update the paths or attributes of the specified files. Currently, for multiple files all modifications have to be of one type (path update or attribute update)

*Caution*: This is in active development, the behaviour might change in the future.

- Behavior:
    - You can move files to non existing paths but then the file will be no longer shown in the frontend.
    - To be shown in the frontend the folder the file is moved to needs to be created by calling the endpoint */files/folders*
    - Currently, two attributes can be modified: `pinned` (bool) and `purpose` (FilePurpose). When `pinned` is set to true, the file will not be affected by retention policy.
- Args:
    - `file_path_updates` **(list[FilePathUpdateInput])**:
        - **`id` (int)**: The ID of the file to update.
        - **`path` (Optional[str])**: The root-level path for the file. Subfolders are not supported.
        - **`folder_name` (Optional[str])**: The name of the root-level folder where the file should be moved. Only root-level folders are allowed.
        - **`pinnned` (Optional[bool])**: Determines if file should be affected by retention policy. On default all files will be deletef after 90 days when not in use.
        - **`purpose` (Optional[FilePurpose])**: The purpose of uploaded file. This will be extended in te future.


- Raises:
    - **HTTPException**: 400, if the provided file is synced with OneDrive, if the file is attached to an assistant or if a folder name is provided.
    - **HTTPException**: 403, if the current user does not have permission to modify the file.
    - **HTTPException**: 422, when users tries to upate paths and attributes in single request.

- Returns:
    - `list[FileBase]`: The updated list of files.

post.description:
Upload files for a specified purpose.

*Caution*: This is in active development, the behaviour might change in the future.

- Behavior:
    - You can upload files to non existing folder by specifying them in the path. This does not create the folder! The file will be updated with this path as metadata but not be shon in the frontend.
    - For a folder and its contents to be shown in the frontend you need to create the folder by calling the endpoint */files/folders*

- Args:
    - `files` **(list[UploadFile])**: The files to upload.
    - `purpose` **(Optional[FilePurpose])**: The purpose of the files being uploaded. Defaults to 'assistant'. Other available options: `fine-tune`, `fine-tune-results` and `assistants_output`
    - `path` **(Optional[str])**: The path where the files will be stored. Defaults to '/'.
    - `extract_images` **(Optional[bool])**: Whether to extract images from the files. Defaults to False.

- Raises:
    - **HTTPException**: 400, if more than 10 files are provided of if the file extension is not supported.

- Returns:
    - `list[FileUploadTask]`: The tasks associated with the file uploads.

- Example Value:
    ```json
    {
        "files": [
            {
                "filename": "file1.txt",
                "content_type": "text/plain",
                "size": 1024
            },
            {
                "filename": "image1.png",
                "content_type": "image/png",
                "size": 2048
            }
        ],
        "purpose": "assistants",
        "path": "/uploads",
        "extract_images": true
    }
    ```

get.description:
Retrieve chunks of a file by its ID.

*Caution*: This is in active development, the behaviour might change in the future.

- Args:
    - **`file_id` (int)**: The ID of the file whose chunks are to be retrieved.
    - **`offset` (Optional[UUID])**: The UUID of the chunk to start fetching from. If not provided, fetching starts from the beginning of the file.
    - **`limit` (int)**: The maximum number of chunks to return. Defaults to 10. Must be between 1 and 300.
    - **`with_vectors` (bool)**: Whether to include vector representations in the response. Defaults to `False`.
    - **`filter` (Optional[str])**: A JSON-encoded metadata filter to narrow down the chunks. Supported filter fields include:
        - `document_id`: The ID of the document.
        - `source`: The source of the document (e.g., system, user-uploaded).
        - `source_id`: The source ID of the document.
        - `author`: The author of the document.
        - `start_date` and `end_date`: Date range for filtering.
        - `section`: The section of the document.
        - `page_number`: The page number to filter on.
        - `type`: The document type.
        - `title`: The title of the document.
        - `enabled`: Whether the document is enabled.


- Raises:
    - **HTTPException**: 400, if the provided file is a folder.
    - **HTTPException**: 403, if the current user does not have access to the selected file.

- Returns:
    - `list[DocumentChunk]`: A list of document chunks associated with the file.

post.description:
Read a webpage and return its content.

Functionality also available in the /chat/agent endpoint as the `webscraper` tool.

- Key Body Parameters:
    - `url` (HttpUrl): The URL of the webpage to parse.
    - `response_format` (ReaderResponseFormat): The format of the content (`markdown`, `html`, or `text`).
    - `response_mode` (ReaderResponseMode): The mode of the response (`text` or `json`). Defaults to `text`.

 - Behavior:
    - Parses the content of the URL.
    - Returns the content either as plain text or as a structured JSON response.

- Raises:
    - **HTTPException**: Status codes >= 300 that are returned from the requested URL.
    - **HTTPException**: 503, if the request to the URL could not be completed or initiated.

- Returns:
    - `Union[PlainTextResponse, ReaderResponse]`: The content of the webpage, either as plain text or a structured response.

text-mode.description: Parse URL and respond as plain text with content in markdown format.

json-mode.description: Parse URL and respond as JSON with content in markdown format.

readability-format.description: Parse URL and return the main webpage content in markdown format.

markdown-format.description: Parse URL and return content as text.

text-format.description: Parse URL and return content as text.

html-format.description: Parse URL and return content as HTML.

post.description:
Create reranking of items based on specified criteria.

- Args:
    - `rerank_input` **(RerankInput)**: The input data containing the items to be reranked and the criteria for reranking.
    - `project` **(Optional[str])**: An optional project identifier to categorize the reranking. Defaults to None.

    ### Body Parameters:

    - **`model`** *(str)*: The identifier of the model to use for reranking.
    - **`query`** *(str)*: The query against which the documents will be reranked.
    - **`documents`** *(list[str] or list[RerankInputDocument])*: A list of document objects or strings to rerank. Document objects must include a `text` field, and other fields will be preserved in the response.
    - **`return_documents`** *(bool, optional)*: If `true`, includes document text in the response; otherwise, only relevance scores and indices are returned.
    - **`top_n`** *(int, optional)*: The number of top-ranked documents or indices to return. Defaults to all documents.
    - **`raw_scores`** *(bool, optional)*: If `true`, returns raw (un-normalized) scores.

- Raises:
    - **HTTPException**: 400, if the specified model is not a reranking model

- Returns:
    - `RerankResponse`: The response containing the reranked items.

post.description:
## Detailed field description

### tool_logo

A file containing the tool logo.

Note: The maximum file size is 5MB.

### key
A unique identifier for the tool.

Allowed characters are uppercase letters (A-Z), lowercase letters (a-z), digits (0-9), underscores (_) or hyphens (-).

This is only used internally or in other API endpoints to identify the tool.

### name
A human-readable name for the tool. This is used to display the name in the UI.

Allowed characters are uppercase letters (A-Z), lowercase letters (a-z), digits (0-9), spaces ( ), hyphens (-), slashes (/) or ampersands (&).

### type
The type of tool, e.g., the protocol to connect external servers as tools.

Relevant tool types for external developers are `mcp` and `chatgpt_plugin`.

### description
A human-readable long-form description of the tool, e.g. its functionality or use cases.

This is only used for information purposes in the UI (tools tab).

For MCP servers the instruction and tool descriptions are retrieved from the server.

### category
The category of the tool. Used in the UI to group tools.

Possible values are `datasource`, `output`, and `other`.

### auth_type

Authorization method for external tools, e.g. MCP servers or ChatGPT plugins.

The url field is mandatory for external tools of type `mcp` or `chatgpt_plugin`.

Supported values are `oauth_obo`, `api_key`, and `none`

- **oauth_obo:** For this auth type the field `auth_socpes` is mandatory.
- **api_key:** For this auth type the field `auth_api_key` is mandatory.

A detailed explanation of the authorization methods can be found in
the [documentation](https://docs.int.bayer.com/baychatgpt/restful_api/tools_api/#authorization).

### auth_scopes

Authorization scope used when `auth_type` is `oauth_obo`.

### auth_api_key

API key used when `auth_type` is `api_key`.

### url

URL of the remote server used when `type` is `mcp` or `chatgpt_plugin`.

### access

Visibility of the tool.

Possible values are `private` and `public`.

Note: When `auth_type` is `oauth_obo` the permissions to use the tool are defined by the 
Entra ID application. Hence, tool visibility does not necessarily imply permission to use it.

### group

An additional group name that is used for more fine-grained categorization.

### meta_data

Additional metadata for the tool (e.g., headers, etc.).

Note: For backwards compatibility this can still be used to register a `chatgpt_plugin` via:

```json
{
    "chatgptPluginURL": <CHATGPT PLUGIN URL>,
    "scope": <OAUTH SCOPE>
}
```

### usage_hint

A human-readable short-form description to guide the user when to use the tool.

This is only used for information purposes in the UI (tool tooltip).

### tags

A list of tags to help identify or filter the tool.

Note: A tag must be at least 2 characters long.

Chunk text.

Args:
    chunking_input: Input parameters for chunking.
    project: An optional project identifier to categorize the chunking.
    current_user: The current authenticated user.
    chunking_service: The chunking service.
    langfuse_client: The langfuse client for tracing.

Returns:
    ChunkingOutput containing the chunked text.

recursive_character.summary: Split text using recursive character splitter.
recursive_character.description: This example shows how to use basic splitting method. The text is being chunked into chunks of pre-defined size, based on the selected separators.

value.text: This is a sample document for recursive character chunking. <split> In this example text will be chunked by `<split>` separator.

markdown_structure.summary: Split markdown text based on the syntax.
markdown_structure.description: This example shows how to use markdown splitter, which splits text based on the markdown syntax. It creates, syntax-aware chunks, meaning that chunks can represent table pars, paragraphs, titles, etc.

value.text:
# Introduction

This is a sample document.

## Section 1

This is section 1. Markdown splitter splits text based on the structure of the markdown document. It considers sections, paragraphs, tables and more. Let's see how it works on tables:

 | Month    | Savings |
| -------- | ------- |
| January  | $250    |
| February | $80     |
| March    | $420  |

semantic.description: Semantic chunking is the most complicated as it compares semantic meaning of parts of the texts and determines which parts should be merged and which should be splited.

value.text: This is a sample document for demonstrating semantic chunking. Technically it should be able to chunk texts into semantically coherent chunks. Let's talk about the weather today to see this in action. Weather is very nice today in my city but it is a bit too windy to fully enjoy the time outside. Switching focus now back to chunking methods - semantic chunking is the most expensive chunking method as it requires multi-turn comparisons between parts of texts.

pass_metadata_and_doc_id.summary: Pass metadata and document id that will be added to all chunks.
pass_metadata_and_doc_id.description: This example shows how to pass metadata that will be added to resulting chunks and how to customize the id of the output chunks.

value.text: This is a sample document for recursive character chunking. <split> In this example text will be chunked by `<split>` separator.

ChatCompletion.description: Model for chat completion in non-streaming mode.

ChatCompletionChunk.title: ChatCompletionChunk
ChatCompletionChunk.description: Model for chat completion chunk in streaming mode.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the function to be called. Must be a-z, A-Z, 0-9, or contain underscores and dashes, with a maximum length of 64.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of what the function does.

ChatCompletionFunction.title: ChatCompletionFunction
ChatCompletionFunction.description: Model for function call schema in chat completion.

model.title: Model
model.description: ID of the model to use. See []() for details on which models work with the API.

messages.title: Messages
messages.description: A list of messages comprising the conversation so far. [Example Python code](https://github.com/openai/openai-cookbook/blob/main/examples/How_to_format_inputs_to_ChatGPT_models.ipynb).

temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.description:
What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic.
We generally recommend altering this or `top_p` but not both.

top_p.title: Top P
top_p.description:
An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.
We generally recommend altering this or `temperature` but not both.

stream.title: Stream
stream.description: If set, partial message deltas will be sent, like in ChatGPT. Tokens will be sent as data-only server-sent events as they become available, with the stream terminated by a `data: [DONE]` message.

stop.title: Stop
stop.description: Up to 4 sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens.

max_tokens.title: Max Tokens
max_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens allowed for the generated answer. By default, the number of tokens the model can return will be (4096 - prompt tokens).

presence_penalty.title: Presence Penalty
presence_penalty.description: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics.

frequency_penalty.title: Frequency Penalty
frequency_penalty.description: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim.

logit_bias.title: Logit Bias
logit_bias.description: Modify the likelihood of specified tokens appearing in the completion. Accepts a json object that maps tokens (specified by their token ID in the tokenizer) to an associated bias value from -100 to 100. Mathematically, the bias is added to the logits generated by the model prior to sampling. The exact effect will vary per model, but values between -1 and 1 should decrease or increase likelihood of selection; values like -100 or 100 should result in a ban or exclusive selection of the relevant token.

user.title: User
user.description: A unique identifier representing your end-user, which can help Azure OpenAI to monitor and detect abuse.

n.title: N
n.description: How many chat completion choices to generate for each input message.

seed.title: Seed
seed.description: If specified, our system will make a best effort to sample deterministically, such that repeated requests with the same `seed` and parameters should return the same result.Determinism is not guaranteed, and you should refer to the `system_fingerprint` response parameter to monitor changes in the backend.

logprobs.title: Logprobs
logprobs.description: Whether to return log probabilities of the output tokens or not. If true, returns the log probabilities of each output token returned in the `content` of `message`. This option is currently not available on the `gpt-4-vision-preview` model.

top_logprobs.title: Top Logprobs
top_logprobs.description: An integer between 0 and 5 specifying the number of most likely tokens to return at each token position, each with an associated log probability. `logprobs` must be set to `true` if this parameter is used.

response_format.title: Response Format
response_format.description: An object specifying the format that the model must output. Used to enable JSON mode.

tools.title: Tools
tools.description: A list of tools the model may call. Currently, only functions are supported as a tool. Use this to provide a list of functions the model may generate JSON inputs for.

functions.title: Functions
functions.description: Deprecated in favor of `tools`. A list of functions the model may generate JSON inputs for.

function_call.title: Function Call
function_call.description: Deprecated in favor of `tool_choice`. Controls how the model responds to function calls. "none" means the model does not call a function, and responds to the end-user. "auto" means the model can pick between an end-user or calling a function.  Specifying a particular function via `{"name":\ "my_function"}` forces the model to call that function. "none" is the default when no functions are present. "auto" is the default if functions are present.

stream_options.description: Options for streaming response. Only set this when you set stream: true.

reasoning_effort.title: Reasoning Effort
reasoning_effort.description: Constrains effort on reasoning for reasoning models. Currently supported values are low, medium, and high. Reducing reasoning effort can result in faster responses and fewer tokens used on reasoning in a response. Only supported for o1 and o3-mini models.

messages.title: Messages
messages.description: A list of messages forming the conversation context. Each message should include metadata and roles such as `user`, `system`, or `assistant`.

model.title: Model
model.description: ID of the model to use. Required if `assistant_id` is not provided.

temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.description: Sampling temperature to control randomness in responses. Higher values (e.g., 0.8) produce more random outputs, while lower values (e.g., 0.2) make the responses more deterministic.

max_tokens.title: Max Tokens
max_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens for the response.

stream.title: Stream
stream.description: Whether to use streaming mode. If `true`, tokens are sent incrementally as they are generated.

top_p.title: Top P
top_p.description: An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling. Only tokens with top cumulative probability `top_p` are considered.

n.title: N
n.description: The number of response choices to generate for each input.

presence_penalty.title: Presence Penalty
presence_penalty.description: Penalty for introducing new tokens. Positive values make the model more likely to generate new topics.

frequency_penalty.title: Frequency Penalty
frequency_penalty.description: Penalty for repeating tokens. Positive values make the model less likely to repeat content.

logit_bias.title: Logit Bias
logit_bias.description: A mapping of token IDs to bias values. Bias values range from -100 (strongly discourage) to 100 (strongly encourage).

functions.title: Functions
functions.description: A list of functions the assistant may call. This is used to provide JSON-based responses.

function_call.title: Function Call
function_call.description: Controls how the assistant responds to function calls. `"auto"` allows the model to decide, or specify a function name using `{"name": "function_name"}`.

seed.title: Seed
seed.description: Seed value for deterministic sampling. When specified, repeated requests with the same seed and parameters yield similar results. Determinism is not guaranteed.

response_format.description: Specifies the format for the model's output, such as `JSON` or `text`.

tool_keys.title: Tool Keys
tool_keys.description: A list of tool keys specifying the tools the assistant can access. Defaults to commonly used tools like `document_question_answering`, `document_summarizer`, etc.

assistant_id.title: Assistant Id
assistant_id.description: The UUID of a predefined assistant. If provided, this overrides `model`, `temperature`, and `instructions` parameters.

hidden.title: Hidden
hidden.description: Whether the conversation is hidden from the myGenAssist UI.

instructions.title: Instructions
instructions.description: Custom system instructions for the assistant. Cannot be used with a system message in `messages`.

ChatInputAgent.title: ChatInputAgent
ChatInputAgent.description: Schema for agent chat inputs, specifying parameters for interaction with the Assistant in detail.

messages.title: Messages
messages.description: A list of messages that make up the conversation so far. Each message includes role metadata (e.g., user, assistant) and message content. See [examples](https://github.com/openai/openai-cookbook/blob/main/examples/How_to_format_inputs_to_ChatGPT_models.ipynb) for formatting guidance.

model.title: Model
model.description: The ID of the model used to generate responses. Required if `assistant_id` is not provided. Refer to the model documentation for compatible model IDs.

temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.description: Controls response randomness. Range is 0 to 2, with higher values (e.g., 0.8) producing more varied responses and lower values (e.g., 0.2) yielding more focused results. We recommend adjusting either `temperature` or `top_p`, not both.

max_tokens.title: Max Tokens
max_tokens.description: Limits the number of tokens generated in the response.

stream.title: Stream
stream.description: Enables streaming mode if set to True, sending responses as data-only server-sent events in real-time. The stream ends with a `data: [DONE]` message.

top_p.title: Top P
top_p.description: Nucleus sampling parameter, where the model considers only tokens within the cumulative top `top_p` probability mass (e.g., 0.1 considers the top 10% most probable tokens). We recommend adjusting either `top_p` or `temperature`, not both.

n.title: N
n.description: Specifies the number of response variations to generate per input message. Defaults to 1.

stop.title: Stop
stop.description: A list of up to 4 sequences where the response generation will halt when any sequence is encountered.

presence_penalty.title: Presence Penalty
presence_penalty.description: Adjusts the likelihood of generating new topics in the response. Positive values (between -2.0 and 2.0) encourage diversity by penalizing tokens that have appeared already.

frequency_penalty.title: Frequency Penalty
frequency_penalty.description: Reduces the model‚Äôs likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim. Positive values penalize frequent tokens within the response, encouraging diverse token usage.

logit_bias.title: Logit Bias
logit_bias.description: Adjusts the probability of specific tokens appearing in the response. Takes a dictionary where keys are token IDs and values are bias values from -100 to 100, affecting token selection. A bias of -100 excludes the token, while 100 guarantees its presence.

functions.title: Functions
functions.description: Deprecated in favor of tools. A list of functions the model may generate JSON inputs for.

function_call.title: Function Call
function_call.description: Deprecated in favor of `tool_choice`. Controls how the model responds to function calls. "none" means the model does not call a function and responds to the end-user. "auto" means the model can pick between an end-user or calling a function. Specifying a particular function via `{'name': 'my_function'}` forces the model to call that function.

tools.title: Tools
tools.description: List of tools accessible to the Assistant for interacting with external data sources or performing specific actions.

tool_choice.title: Tool Choice
tool_choice.description: Specifies a tool and configuration for use. Accepts a tool name (string) or a dictionary with detailed configurations.

seed.title: Seed
seed.description: Seed value for random number generation, ensuring repeatability of responses when using stochastic models. Use the same `seed` to achieve consistent responses across similar requests.

response_format.description: Sets the format for the Assistant's response (e.g., plain text or JSON). Determines the structure of the response output.

timeout.title: Timeout
timeout.description: Maximum allowable time in seconds for response generation before timing out.

conversation_id.title: Conversation Id
conversation_id.description: Identifier for ongoing conversations, facilitating continuous interactions across multiple requests within the same session.

hypothetical_question.title: Hypothetical Question
hypothetical_question.description: If `True`, enables handling of hypothetical questions, allowing responses even when information is inferred rather than directly available.

lost_in_the_middle.title: Lost In The Middle
lost_in_the_middle.description: If `True`, adjusts the model's focus to avoid missing crucial information in the middle sections of documents, ensuring a more balanced assessment of document content.

diversify_ranking.title: Diversify Ranking
diversify_ranking.description: If `True`, diversifies the ranking of retrieved documents, reducing redundancy and increasing the range of perspectives in the response.

key.title: Key
key.description: A unique identifier for the tool. Allowed characters are uppercase letters (A-Z), lowercase letters (a-z), digits (0-9), underscores (_) or hyphens (-). This is only used internally or in other API endpoints to identify the tool.

description.title: Description
description.description: A human-readable long-form description of the tool, e.g. its functionality or use cases. This is only used for information purposes. For MCP servers the instruction and tool descriptions are retrieved from the server.

name.title: Name
name.description: A human-readable name for the tool. This is only used for information purposes. Allowed characters are uppercase letters (A-Z), lowercase letters (a-z), digits (0-9), spaces ( ), hyphens (-), slashes (/) or ampersands (&).

type.description: The type of tool, e.g., the protocol to connect external servers as tools. Relevant tool types for external developers are `mcp` and `chatgpt_plugin`.

category.description: The category of the tool. Used to group tools. Possible values are `datasource`, `output`, and `other`.

auth_type.description: Authorization method for external tools, e.g. MCP servers or ChatGPT plugins. The url field is mandatory for external tools of type `mcp` or `chatgpt_plugin`. Supported values are `oauth_obo`, `api_key`, and `none`. More details can be found in the [documentation](https://docs.int.bayer.com/baychatgpt/restful_api/tools_api/#authorization).

url.title: Url

access.description: Visibility of the tool. Possible values are `private` and `public`. Note: When `auth_type` is `oauth_obo` the permissions to use the tool are determined by the Entra ID application. Hence tool visibility does not necessarily imply permission to use it.

group.title: Group
group.description: An optional additional group name that is used for more fine-grained categorization.

meta_data.title: Meta Data
meta_data.description: Optional additional metadata for the tool (e.g., headers, etc.).

usage_hint.title: Usage Hint

tags.title: Tags
